boardgame.description: Regarded by many as Reiner Knizia's masterpiece, Tigris _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Euphrates is set in the ancient fertile crescent with players building civilizations through tile placement. Players are given four different leaders: farming, trading, religion, and government. The leaders are used to collect victory points in these same categories. However, your score at the end of the game is the number of points in your weakest category, which encourages players not to get overly specialized. Conflict arises when civilizations connect on the board, i.e., external conflicts, with only one leader of each type surviving such a conflict. Leaders can also be replaced within a civilization through internal conflicts._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Starting in the Mayfair edition from 2008, Tigris _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Euphrates included a double-sided game board and extra components for playing an advanced version of the game. This _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;ziggurat expansion_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;, initially released as a separate item in Germany for those who already owned the base game, is a special monument that extends across five spaces of the board. The monument can be built if a player has a cross of five civilization tokens of the same color by discarding those five tokens and replacing them with the ziggurat markers, placing a ziggurat tower upon the middle tile. The five ziggurat markers cannot be destroyed. All rules regarding monuments apply to the ziggurat monument as well. If your king is inside the kingdom of the ziggurat, you will get one victory point in a color of your choice at the end of your turn._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Some versions of Tigris _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Euphrates are listed as being for 2-4 players, while others incorrectly state that they're for 3-4 players. Tigris _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Euphrates is part of what is considered Reiner Knizia's tile-laying trilogy._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Tigre _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Euphrate (version Française de 2004) Il y a des milliers d_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;années, en Mésopotamie, région fertile entre 2 rivières, le Tigre et l_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;Euphrate, une nouvelle civilisation naissait. Les dirigeants de la plupart de ces petits royaumes indépendants se considéraient comme les représentants de Dieu sur terre et créérent les premières civilisations. Les marchands sumériens développèrent les principes de base de l_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;écriture cunéiforme avant même les Egyptiens. Les payasans de ces régions inventèrent vraissemblablement la roue afin d_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;amener leurs récoltes en ville. Essayez de développer votre civilisation de manière constante et égale (Si besoin au détriment des autres joueurs). Pour y parvenir vous disposez de 4 dirigeants, le Roi, le Prêtre, le Fermier et le Marchand. Grâce à eux transformez vos petites villes en vastes royaumes. Mais n_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;oubliez pas que le bassin fertile n_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;est pas assez grand pour tout le monde. Les démonstrations de forces et les révoltes sont à l_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ordre du jour. La seule manière de survivre est de se développer de manière équilibrée. Utilisez vos dirigeants pour faire croître simultanément tous les aspects de votre société. Une bonne planification est indispensable afin de laisser une trace de votre dynastie dans l_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;histoire. Jeu de Reiner Knizia pour 2 à 4 joueurs à partir de 12 ans. Durée 90 minutes. Theme: Regarded by many as Reiner Knizia_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s masterpiece, the game is set in the ancient fertile crescent with players building civilizations through tile placement. Players are given four different leaders: farming, trading, religion, and government. The leaders are used to collect victory points in these same categories. However, your score at the end of the game is the number of points in your weakest category, which encourages players not to get overly specialized. Conflict arises when civilizations connect on the board, i.e., external conflicts, with only one leader of each type surviving such a conflict. Leaders can also be replaced within a civilization through internal conflicts. See Details (more info) or below for complete selling, payment and shipping conditions.
